column4: I need some help with fsck options. I dont know which ones I need to use. I've tried different combos and nothing is happening. http://linux.die.net/man/8/fsck
fsck /dev/sda# where # is the partition number
if there are problems it will ask what it should do. if you dont know the right answer fsck -a will say "yes" toeverything
if you have raid you need to fsck /dev/md#
i did md1 and it checked it, but i need a more through check like chkdsk, to check for hdd errors
install smartmontools and use smartctl to check the smart status
i have two other paritions? sda1 and sdb2. SMART logs are ok. i cant install smartmontools since im using a network boot
i thought you said you had raid. is sda1 part of the raid device?
i didnt build the filesystem... ill show u what it looks like... its weird, actually. http://i.imgur.com/EcctF.png
i think its RAID1 for the OS and then RAID0 for the rest of the hdds
sda1 is part of the raid device. the mdadm drivers have an exclusive lock on the device file. you would have to break the raid to gain access to sda1
if its broken, can it be rebuilt without losing data?
yes, but why would you want to access sda1?
you dont need access to sda1 to do that. just look at the smart data
and if you want something more than the smart data you might look at hdparm, but you have no good reason to break the raid. it will tell you nothing you cannot figure out otherwise
ok sounds like the drives are good then. do you have some reason for believing otherwsie?
im having an issue saving some data to the hdds, which why i was thinking its the hdds
an issue can you be more specific
what is the path of this missing file?
^^ i dont know off the top of my head, but i know its long
